intro: Licaria misantlae, commonly known as the Misantla licaria, is a species of flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and produces small, white or greenish flowers. Its leaves are often used in traditional Mexican cuisine for their distinctive flavor. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a vulnerable species.
